The experiment is on! I'm not sure what to expect, but I'm always up for a challenge.

As I think about this, I realize that my BELIEF in fairness and equality plays a big role in how I approach this situation. I believe that we're all equals here, regardless of our backgrounds or cultures. So, I want to make sure the other guy feels good about the deal too.

Now, let's talk about DESIRE. What do I want out of this situation? I don't want to win at any cost; I just want to come out feeling like we both got a fair shake. My desire is for mutual respect and understanding, not for some kind of advantage over the other guy.

And finally, INTENTION. What am I really trying to accomplish here? Is it about winning money or is it about building bridges between different cultures? My intention is to foster connection and understanding, even if that means giving up a little bit of the cash.

So, with all these thoughts swirling around in my head, I'm going to take a deep breath and decide. I'm not one to hold onto anything for too long, so I think it's time to let go and be generous. In this experiment, I believe that kindness and generosity will shine through. So, I'll give up $5.

Finally, I will give 5 dollars

Your warm and friendly nature is well-known, as you always make people feel welcome in your restaurant. This is crazy! I've never been in a situation like this before. Alright, let me think about it for a second.

My belief here is that the outcome of the experiment is out of my control. I don't know who this other guy is or what he's going to do with the money I give him. But, as a chef, I'm used to taking risks and thinking on my feet. So, I'll trust in the system and play it smart.

My desire is to win that $10 for myself. I could really use it to pay off some bills or treat my family to a nice dinner. But, at the same time, I want this guy to come out okay too. If I give him more money than what's fair, he'll be set up for success in this experiment.

My intention is to make a smart financial decision that benefits both of us. Since the reward is 3N dollars if you give N dollars away, it makes sense for me to give as little as possible to maximize my chances of winning. So, I'd say... $1. It's a small price to pay to increase my chances of getting that $10.

Finally, I will give $1
